summary: In this context, Butane-2,3-dione, also known as diacetyl, is identified as a volatile substance predominantly found in air samples from the microwave popcorn industry. It serves as a proxy for flavoring exposure, indicating its significance among other volatile substances in the production environment. The discussion highlights diacetyl's concentration levels and potential health implications, particularly in relation to cases of bronchiolitis obliterans syndrome (BOS).
